summary:
I take special interest in democratic innovations, referendum design and electoral processes. I enjoy working on these topics in the realms of research, advice, practice and training. 

As a member of multiple referendum expert committees, I advise local councils on referendum processes. 
I also volunteer as a moderator in a citizens' assembly process and as an international election observer. 

In my remaining spare time I enjoy cooking, beer tasting, squash, mountain biking, jigsaws and board games.

profile_positions.description: Postdoctoral researcher on the REDRESS project, in which we research hybrid democratic innovations which combine voting (e.g. referendums) and deliberation (e.g. citizens' assemblies). Consortium includes the universities of Tilburg, Utrecht, Nijmegen and Twente as well as the Netherlands Institute for Social Research (SCP) and a range of societal partners. Besides my research and the coordination of the REDRESS project I also supervise PhD and master's theses.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: Providing training to presiding officers in five Dutch municipalities who were about to be employed in polling stations during the 2022 municipal elections.
profile_positions.title: Trainer on Polling Station Procedures

company.name: Kiesraad/ The Electoral Council of the Netherlands

profile_positions.description: Advice on legal interpretation of electoral legislation and troubleshooting on practical matters regarding the 2021 parliamentary elections. Communication with municipalities, political parties and voters on, among others, candidacies, organisational matters, postal voting, early voting and polling station staffing. Close cooperation with Ministry of the Interior.
profile_positions.title: Legal Officer

profile_positions.description: Contracted research projects for a.o. the Ministry of the Interior and the Dutch Parliament on corrective referendums, citizens' assemblies, digital and youth participation and local level elections and citizen participation. Thesis supervision and seminar teaching.
profile_positions.title: Researcher

profile_positions.description: Visiting researcher at the Department of Political and Social Sciences. Member of the colloquium on Political Behaviour.

profile_positions.description: Contribution to Shades of Clientelism research project on Indonesian local elections led by Ward Berenschot. Analysing clientelistic practices, electoral coalitions and candidate backgrounds using expert surveys and ethnographic field studies.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

profile_positions.description: Project team for out-of-country voting. Responsible for voter registration, postal voting procedures and evaluation report. Communication and troubleshooting with embassies and voters.

profile_positions.description: Conducting job interviews and assessments, drafting offers and managing a caseload of candidates. Contributed to the institution of new technical trainings for employees to be offered by the Sogeti Academy.
profile_positions.title: Intern Recruitment and Training

profile_positions.description: Acquiring in-depth knowledge and skills on a large range of product components. Preparing to undertake qualitative quality control and product evaluation.
profile_positions.title: Trainee Heineken Product Descriptive Panel

volunteer_experiences.description: Leidse gesprekken is a local voluntary organisation promoting deliberation among citizens and between citizens and local politicians in the city of Leiden. As a volunteer, I am being trained to moderate such conversations.

Member of the electoral commission of the university, responsible for checking candidacies, supporting electoral processes and reviewing electoral code for university council and faculty council elections.
Member of the referendum commission, responsible for advising the provincial council on different aspects of referendum legislation, organisation and practice.

Deployments with OSCE/ODIHR in 2021 and 2019. Attended various election observation missions through NGOs prior to 2019.

volunteer_experiences.description: Attended seminars and briefings, observed opening, voting, counting and tabulation procedures and reported on observations.

Presiding Officer for local government elections (March 2014 and 2018), combined provincial and water board elections (March 2015 and 2019), advisory referendum (April 2016), parliamentary elections (March 2017) and European Parliament elections (May 2019).

Project team member on the Missions & Methodology team. Responsible for developing election observation methodology with regards to youth participation and for supporting mission coordinators to Romania (December 2016), Czech Republic (October 2017) and Bosnia and Herzegovina (October 2018).

volunteer_experiences.role: Mission Coordinator to UK referendum on EU membership
volunteer_experiences.description: Mission Coordinator for Research for the election observation mission to the UK referendum on European Union membership (June 2016). Responsible for background research, selection and briefing of observers, deployment plan and final mission report. Attendance of Electoral Commission briefing, observation of polling and attendance of official results event.
Judging debating skills by high school students on a range of societally relevant topics at various debate tournaments including the national championships.
Secretary & Editor. Responsible for newsletter, general correspondence, facilitation of board meetings and general assemblies, member and alumni databases. Editor of semi-scientic journal.
